ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed my Chinese knowledge a lot, sentence structures, more vocabulary, structures, writing words, speaking, and so much more.
Advanced Mandarin grammar skills and cultural analysis between ancient and modern China
I greatly improved my Chinese language and learned about Chinese culture.

I learned to take in information quickly, as we learned a lot of characters each lesson, and I also learned to manage my time, as we had a substantial amount of work for the class, but it would mostly be due at the end of each week.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength of this course was how engaging the whole class was and how every student was involved in discussions, it was also very through and covered detail by detail. A weakness is that I wished I could have conversed with more students in the class through partner discussions and doing projects with different people.
Classes are very engaging; sometimes it feels like all we are doing is reading the literature

Strengths- Course structure was very organized, the textbook passages are good
Weaknesses- Sometimes too much work during asynchronous days
Strength: supportive environment, very clearly and well-structured (could not find a weakness)

I like how the course meets frequently and gives a lot of work (meeting its 1.5 credit designation), since the repetition helps me learn. A weakness may be that some asynchronous assignments feel less helpful/relevant to the current course material, but this could be improved by spending some time to introduce the assignment and talk about it instead of just having a canvas post dictate the assignment for the day.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this class if you are serious about improving your Chinese.
Yes, this class is a great course that introduces advanced language skills without forgetting that writing is still a difficult skill to master.
Yes! I feel like my Chinese speaking and reading skills have improved a lot.
Yes! It is a fun and supportive course to take for anyone looking to improve their Chinese.
Yes, because I enjoyed my time in the class and felt I learned a lot that could be applied in my own life or in the future.
